article_text:
Medicare and Medicaid “are now propelling the nation toward bankruptcy” unless a conservative “like Jeb Bush or Carly Fiorina can set them on a sustainable path,” writes our columnist Holman Jenkins. He takes on the criticisms of Ms. Fiorina’s Hewlett-Packard tenure made by Donald Trump and others.

“Look at HP’s stock chart under Ms. Fiorina, who had the misfortune to arrive eight months before the tech bubble burst: It’s indistinguishable from Microsoft, Intel, Oracle, Cisco, etc. By the idiotic standard her critics...

twitter.description: A review of Ms. Fiorina’s tenure at Hewlett-Packard. Plus, Putin’s propaganda machine, and taxpayers subsidize law schools.
twitter.creator: @FreemanWSJ
twitter.title: The Case for Carly
